revised_title: Molecular Evidence Supports Vicariance as a Driver of Rainforest Biodiversity
tldr: The authors analyzed mitochondrial DNA sequences in six rainforest-dwelling vertebrate species in northeastern Australia and found evidence for vicariance, supporting the idea that rainforest species diverged due to historical refuges during the Pleistocene era. This study contributes to understanding the origin of high species diversity in tropical rainforests.
